author: Tony Merevick
title: Gordon Ramsay Is Trashing People's Cooking on Twitter - Thrillist
text: ‚Äî Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 12, 2017 Pretty brutal, right? Well, that's not surprising. What you might find surprising, however, is some of of his other responses to fans' cooking in which he actually praises their dishes: First attempt at @GordonRamsay beef Wellington! pic.twitter.com/lSnhPcDPY0 ‚Äî Ashley Travis (@MrsAshleyTravis) February 13, 2017 Looks good Ashley https://t.co/Md9FfiYAVs ‚Äî Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 13, 2017 My 1st Indulgent Chocolate Raspberry Tart (Raspberry in the filling) w/ the help of Chef @GordonRamsay 's Home Cooking book üçΩ @djshaunoneale pic.twitter.com/m9XLbWnnXV ‚Äî Michael W. Kellar (@MichaelWKellar) February 13, 2017 Looks great Michael https://t.co/cgRLdtMIde ‚Äî Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 13, 2017 Doing @GordonRamsay 's smoky pulled pork with a chipotle mayo today üë®üèª‚Äçüç≥ pic.twitter.com/xIp5UGHdac ‚Äî Jake Vezina (@Jakevezina) February 4, 2017 Looks great Jake https://t.co/yIlAZmDxZl ‚Äî Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 4, 2017 Here's what I cooked up last night thanks to the @GordonRamsay @masterclass cc: @n_arbs pic.twitter.com/UzbnrgU97i ‚Äî Sabrina M. (@c0Sabrina) February 4, 2017 Looking good Sabrina https://t.co/zfVetXPoFO ‚Äî Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 4, 2017 Of course, it's probably safe to say at least a few people are trying to elicit vicious responses from the chef with the images their posting, which is also pretty funny. Anyway, tweet him at your own risk. h/t Munchies Sign up here for our daily Thrillist email, and get your fix of the best in food/drink/fun. Tony Merevick is Cities News Editor at Thrillist and is really tempted to send a photo of his next home-cooked meal. Send news tips to news@thrillist.com and follow him on Twitter @tonymerevick .
